meanings.definition: The act of slowing down or hindering progress.
meanings.sent1: The heavy traffic caused a significant retardation in our journey.
meanings.sent2: The construction work on the road led to a temporary retardation of our plans.
meanings.sent3: The turtle's slow pace was a cute form of retardation in the race.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog created a visual retardation of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rain brought a noticeable retardation to the outdoor event.

meanings.definition: The state of being delayed or held back in development.
meanings.sent1: The student's frequent absences resulted in a noticeable retardation of his academic progress.
meanings.sent2: The economic downturn caused a significant retardation in the company's growth.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning clock was a funny form of retardation in keeping time.
meanings.sent4: The tangled wires caused a literal retardation in the completion of the project.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog brought a sudden retardation to the morning commute.

meanings.definition: A condition of limited intellectual ability.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the child with a form of mental retardation.
meanings.sent2: The educational program was designed to support students with intellectual retardation.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful professor's absent-mindedness was a humorous form of retardation in his work.
meanings.sent4: The closed-mindedness of some individuals can be a social retardation to progress.
meanings.sent5: The lack of critical thinking skills can lead to a significant retardation in problem-solving abilities.
